page.title: 14BIOGRAPHY
page.content: {DEREK ALLEN { }THE FIRST TOWN CRIER IN HERNE BAY WAS MR. A. TINGLEY. HE STARTED IN 1833. IN 1841 AN URBAN DISTRICT COUNCIL TOOK OVER. THEY MADE THE CRIER SELF-EMPLOYED. HE WAS PAID FOR OFFICIAL CRIES BUT HE COULD ALSO CRY FOR TRADESMEN. THE LAST RECORDED TOWN CRIER WAS IN 192O. THE OLD CRIERS WORE A RED CLOAK AND A TOP HAT. THEIR BELL IS IN THE HERNE BAY MUSEUM. THE JOB OF TOWN CRIER WAS REVIVED IN 1977. THE TERMS OF OFFICE WERE "ONLY THOSE CRIES REQUIRED BY THE APPOINTEES ATTRACT RENUMERATION BUT YOU SHALL BE FREE TO CRY FOR WHOSOEVER SHALL REWARD YOU". THE PRESENT TOWN CRIER,{DEREK ALLEN, MUST SUPPLY HIS OWN UNIFORM WHICH IS ROYAL BLUE AND SILVER. THERE ARE TRAILING RIBBONS ON THE HELMET ON HERNE BAY'S COAT OF ARMS.
